section.name: Quickstart
section.span: Check it out yourself and install the quickstart demo site.
section.p: The HST2 Getting Started packages contain all the core components, and have been pre-configured with a number of modules and settings, to give you a quick overview of the HST2.

subsection.name: Download
subsection.p: Two WAR packages are available for download. You can deploy them in either Tomcat or Jetty or any other servlet container that you prefer. Note: Hippo HST2 has not been released. The following downloads are snapshots of the current build.

li.span: For CMS the quickstart package is called quickstart and this one gettingstarted, while `hst' is not part of the package name. I think all quickstart packages should have `quickstart' in their name and they also all should contain the project (product) name in their name. Or maybe there is some other consistent and clear naming scheme.
li.a: Hippo ECM getting started package WAR
Hippo HST2 getting started package WAR

tr.td: Tomcat 6.0 from the Apache Tomcat website.
Copy the ECM Getting started WAR from the link above to apache-tomcat-6.0.16/webapps/cms.war.
Copy the HST2 Getting started WAR from the link above to apache-tomcat-6.0.16/webapps/site.war.
Start Tomcat with one of the startup scripts in apache-tomcat-6.0.16/bin.
Open your browser and surf to http://localhost:8080/cms/ for the CMS.
Open your browser and surf to http://localhost:8080/site/preview/index for the site.

td.span: This is probably the moment where things can be tried out. Please mention that explicitely. Are there interesting points to try? Please list them here.

p.i: Note: The port number might be different if you configured you application or servlet container to run on a different port. If you deploy the application on a machine other than your local machine you need to change "localhost" to the correct machine name.
